arm_group.description: All subjects receive one dose of 2 g Amoxicillin

brief_summary.textblock:
The hypothesis of the present study is that quantitative and qualitative oral microflora
      alterations and changes in antibiotic susceptibility among oral commensal microflora will
      occur following a single dose administration of amoxicillin.

detailed_description.textblock:
A total of 33 healthy volunteers, 16 males and 17 females, will be included. Written
      informed consent will be obtained from all participants.

      Subjects will be excluded if they have taken antibiotics within the previous three months,
      are pregnant, breast-feeding or allergic against penicillin.

      The participants will be given a single dose of 2 g amoxicillin. Saliva samples will be
      collected before administration of antibiotics (day 1) and on day 2, 5, 10, 17 and 24.
      Un-stimulated saliva will be accumulated in a plastic container. Concentration of
      amoxicillin in saliva will be measured on day 1, 2 and 5. Samples will be used for the
      determination of antibiotic concentration. Analyses of the sensitivities to amoxicillin and
      some other clinically relevant antibiotic compounds will also be performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Written informed consent

          -  Healthy

          -  Age 18-45

          -  Understands the study procedure and speaks Swedish and/or English

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Treatment with antibiotics within the previous three months

          -  Pregnant

          -  Breast-feeding

          -  Allergic against penicillin

          -  Concomitantly participate in another medical product study

          -  Treatment with any kind of medication, health food preparations or probiotics

facility.name: Karolinska University Hospital. Department of Dental Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Susceptibility Changes Among Oral Microorganisms Following Single Dose Antibiotic Prophylaxis

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Dental Medicine, Karolinska Institute

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative and qualitative changes in the oral microflora will be determined as well as changes is susceptibility to amoxicillin among these commensals.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of amoxicillin in saliva after one dose administration of amoxicillin

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
